title: How to Make Earl Grey Pudding

steps.headline: Make the milk tea.
steps.description: Place 1/2 the milk and tea leaves in a small saucepan, boil over medium heat for about 5 min. Strain tea and add sugar and the other half of the milk.

steps.headline: Beat egg and egg yolks in large bowl but taking care not to generate too much foam.
steps.description: Add milk tea from step 1, divide among six oven-proof containers (ramekins or oven-proof tea cups if you have them).

steps.headline: Place pudding cups in a shallow pan, fill the pan with 70–80 °C (158–176 °F) water until the water almost reaches the same level as the pudding liquid.
steps.description: Bake for about 30 minutes and cool in fridge for at least 1 hour before eating.

steps.headline: While pudding is baking, make caramel sauce.
steps.description: Place sugar and water in saucepan and heat over medium heat. Do not stir. When color turns dark golden, remove from heat and add the hot water. Cool at room temperature.

text: Preheat oven to 170ºC (about 330F).  Make the milk tea. Place 1/2 the milk and tea leaves in a small saucepan, boil over medium heat for about 5 min. Strain tea and add sugar and the other half of the milk. Beat egg and egg yolks in large bowl but taking care not to generate too much foam. Add milk tea from step 1, divide among six oven-proof containers (ramekins or oven-proof tea cups if you have them). Place pudding cups in a shallow pan, fill the pan with 70–80 °C (158–176 °F) water until the water almost reaches the same level as the pudding liquid. Bake for about 30 minutes and cool in fridge for at least 1 hour before eating. While pudding is baking, make caramel sauce. Place sugar and water in saucepan and heat over medium heat. Do not stir. When color turns dark golden, remove from heat and add the hot water. Cool at room temperature. Serve. Pour caramel sauce over pudding.
